title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2017 Simone Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: As part of the series of wines from this estate honoring women in the family, this release is named after the winemaker's mother. It is an attractive blend of Syrah and Grenache, crisp and clean with light fruity flavors and lively acidity. Drink now.

title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2015 Lemberger (Finger Lakes)
description: High-toned raspberry is mellowed by vanilla and anise on the nose of this wine. A brisk mouthfeel and a tart cherry flavor makes for a refreshing start, with sweet oak tones hiding in the background.

title: Fattoria del Cerro 2016  Chianti Colli Senesi
description: This opens with dark berry, cedar and incense hints. The straightforward, savory palate offers red plum, star anise and bell pepper notes alongside round tannins. Drink soon.

title: Fattoria San Donato 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano
description: Delicate but pretty citrus blossom, ripe orchard fruit and wet stone scents lead the nose of this wine. The bright, savory palate doles out yellow pear, green melon, nectarine and saline hints alongside tangy acidity.

title: Fenestra 2013 Conjugation Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Nicely balanced and full bodied, this Malbec blend is fruit-driven, tasting like blackberries and black cherries, with minimal spicy oak additions. It has a smooth sleek texture and very light tannins.

title: Fern Ridge 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Bright, light and easygoing, with aromas of lemon, pear juice, melon, peach and a touch of green beans. The texture is slippery but nicely balanced by refreshing acidity, finishing on a herbal note. Drink now.

title: Figuière 2017 Magali Signature Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Packed with fruitiness, this wine is textured with some minerality as well as given a crisp edge by the citrus acidity. The caramel flavor, red-fruit ripeness and tang at the end give a ready-to-drink wine.

title: Fleurs de Prairie 2017 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This soft and ripe wine, with its classic blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah, is full in the mouth and rich. Raspberry and red-currant flavors are right up front along with caramel richness. Drink this warm wine now.

title: Giesen 2015 The Brothers Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: Aromas of ripe red berries, cola, vanilla, mocha and spicy, slightly soapy oak are followed by a juicy line of acidity and a spine of tightly-wound tannins, held together by plush, tangy red fruit in this medium-bodied wine. This is a simple but enjoayble wine.

title: Girasole 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: A dark color and lots of concentrated, focused, fruit aromas and flavors make this medium-bodied wine very appealing. Black-cherry, blueberry and chocolate flavors are supported by firm velvety tannins and carried to a lingering finish.

title: Guicciardini Strozzi 2016 Principe Strozzi  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: This wine's citrus, spring flower, ripe orchard fruit and cut grass aromas delicately lift out of the glass. The linear palate offers lemon, mature apple and steely mineral notes alongside fresh acidity.

title: Iron Hub 2014 Esola Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Vivid fruit flavors and a lively texture make this medium-bodied wine very refreshing and mouth-cleansing to sip. It has bright raspberry and ripe blackberry flavors accented by light earthy spicy notes.

title: John Anthony 2014 Crane Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This wine offers a substantial nose of bay leaf and eucalyptus—pleasant and defiant. Huge sweet tannins wrap around sizable power and ripeness, a mix of black cherry and cinnamon-dusted plum.

title: Keuka Spring 2016 Lemberger (Finger Lakes)
description: Dense, dark fruit and spicy raspberry meld with hints of earth, white pepper and orange rind on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is fresher in profile in zesty notes of raspberry and bramble, supported by bright acidity and a medium grip of tannins.

title: La Crema 2014 Panorama Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: The red fruit and flower petals that show on the nose of this bottling are overwhelmed by a clay-like muddy aroma of turned earth. The palate offers cohesive flavors of boysenberry and black raspberry, and that earthy clay component does also arise toward the finish.

title: Le Vigne 2015 Di Ranchita Vista Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)
description: Candied blackberry and a pinch of black pepper make for a concentrated but not overly lush nose on this bottling. The palate is clean and straightforward with rich red fruit and dark spices, framed by even acidity and structure.

title: L'Ecole No. 41 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This is a true pan-Washington Merlot, with fruit coming from nine vineyards across the state. Blended with a good whack of Cabernet Franc (13%) which reveals itself, baking-spice, plum, raspberry and herb aromas are followed by soft ripe fruit flavors, with the tannins pulled back. Herb and raspberry notes linger on the tart finish.

title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2017 Château de Pampelonne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is a delicious wine to drink immediately, crisp with acidity and bright with red-currant fruitiness. Its tangy texture, lively aftertaste and citrus edge are instantly refreshing.
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

title: Lion Ranch 2016 Cuvée Blanc White (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Light pineapple, melon rind and a touch of toast show on the nose of this blend of 67% Grenache Blanc, 28% Roussanne and 5% Picpoul Blanc. The palate is clean and framed by a steely tightness and shows light zippy flavors of lemon peel and a clay-like minerality.

title: Macari 2016 Lifeforce Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Subdued aromas of grapefruit, banana and papaya carry to the juicy, medium-bodied palate. This offers a round, textural mouthfeel, with a brisk, chalky finish.

title: Malenchini 2015 Riserva  (Chianti Superiore)
description: This wine's leather, underbrush and dark fruit aromas emerge from the glass. The lively palate delivers blueberry jam, green peppercorn and licorice touches. Drink though 2020.

title: Malveira 2016 Godello (Monterrei)
description: Dry apple and minerally aromas make for a clean nose. Focused as well as fleshy in feel, with flavors of stone fruits, citrus and slate, this is a mellow white that offers mild but appealing tropical notes on the finish.

title: Mark Ryan 2016 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A blend of fruit from Olsen and Red Willow vineyards, this offers aromas of orange blossom, ripe peach, toast and spice. The medium-bodied palate brings stone-fruit flavors that dip slightly in the middle, finishing bitter. This variety can be a difficult needle to thread, with this one not quite pulling it off.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2007 Federico Paternina Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Plum and raspberry aromas are fresh and jammy, with a mushroom note. On the palate, this aged Rioja is wide but with raw tannins that hammer. Spicy but drawing red-fruit flavors are peppery and lean on a finish that turns tart as it winds down.

title: Medlock Ames 2015 Snakepit Red (Alexander Valley)
description: Made from 71% Merlot and 29% Cabernet Sauvignon this traffics in reductive leathery aromas that lead to thickly layered, smoothly lush flavors highlighted in bitter dust, plum and clove.

title: Mount Fishtail 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A heady mélange of peach, melon, citrus, apple blossoms and snow pea lead into a sea-salt palate with more stone and citrus fruit flavors, focused acidity and just the slightest textural weight.

title: Neyers 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This youthful wine comes out of the gate hugely concentrated and big in reduced aromas of oak. Voluptously lush in dense flavors of crème brûlée, it finds a balance midpalate, buoyed by juicy citrus-backed acidity.

title: Numbskull 2016 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Though not labeled as such, this could be a varietal Merlot (78%), with the balance Cabernet Sauvignon (18%) and Petit Verdot. Exuberant aromas of raspberry compote, toast, green herb and flower lead to plentiful red- and black-fruit flavors, with a toasty finish. It runs a bit hot.

title: Panizzi 2013 Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: French oak, coffee, butterscotch and citrus zest aromas lead the nose of this wine. The medium-bodied palate offers tropical fruit, grapefruit, dried sage and toasted notes, alongside bright acidity.

title: Père Anselme 2016 La Fiole Red (Côtes du Rhône)
description: While subdued on the nose, this wine offers concentrated black cherry and berry flavors on the palate, accented by darker, savory notes of dried sage and earth. Full bodied and juicy, it's framed by fresh acidity and a firmly tannic finish.
